snippet: In the first direct combat since France launched its military operation in Mali, ground troops battled armed Islamist occupiers of a desert village in central Mali.
abstract: Malian and French officials say that French soldiers are battling Islamist militants in direct clashes on ground in central Mali, acknowledging for first time that France's campaign against militants who have seized much of nation has involved more than just airstrikes.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Bamako, and Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations. Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Paris, Julia Werdigier from London, and Elisabeth Bumiller from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: In the first direct combat since France launched its military operation in Mali, ground troops battled armed Islamist occupiers of a desert village in central Mali.

headline.seo: French and Malian Ground Troops Confront Islamists in Seized Town
headline.main: On the Ground in Mali, French and Local Troops Confront Islamist Forces
headline.print_headline: On the Ground in Mali, French and Local Troops Confront Islamist Forces
